pdqninja.io
Class MapFileIndex<K>

java.lang.Object
  pdqninja.io.MapFileIndex<K>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class MapFileIndex<K>
extends Object
implements Serializable

Maintains an index for the MapFiles. MapFile stores a sequence of keys (and optionally associated values) in a file. An index can be created for this file, where each entry in the index will be a mapping between the key and the offset within the file where that key is written. The size of the index can be reduced if entries are created only for a subset of the keys. For example, the MapFile creates one index entry for every bytesPerIndex number of bytes.

This class manages the index for the MapFile. The index is created when the keys are written to the map file. For each key written to the file, this index object is notified: either via the createIndex(Object, long) to create an index entry, or the skip() method to indicate that a key is being written to the file, but no index entry must be created (that is, we are skipping this key in the index).

The getIndex(int) returns the i-th index entry. If it is known that the keys are stored in sorted order in the map file, this index can be used to efficiently retrieve keys and their values. The getIndexForKey(Object) can be used to locate the neighborhood of a given key. This method returns the exact file offset if this key was part of the index, or the file offset of the largest key that is smaller than this key.

This index can be written to a file using the write(File) method, and read from a file using the read(File) method. In both cases, it is assumed that the keys are serializable.

subIndex

public MapFileIndex<K> subIndex(K fromKey,
                                K toKey)
Creates a view of the index that includes all keys ranging from fromKey and toKey. This sub index begins with the largest index entry that is smaller than the fromKey and ends with smallest index entry that is greater than the toKey.

Parameters:
fromKey - the lower bound of the sub index
toKey - the upper bound of the sub index
Returns:
a sub index view that contains keys in the specified range

distance

public int distance(K fromKey,
                    K toKey)
Returns an approximate number of keys between the specified key range. The number of keys is computed between two index entries: the lower bound is the largest index entry that is smaller than the fromKey, and the upper bound is the smallest index entry that is greater than the toKey.

Parameters:
fromKey - the lower bound of the range
toKey - the upper bound of the range
Returns:
the approximate number of keys in the range
